sentences.en: He needs morphine to deaden the pain in his chest.
sentences.cn: 他需要吗啡来缓解胸痛。

sentences.en: He was given drugs to deaden the pain.
I had shut my eyes, I confused myself on purpose to deaden the pain.
sentences.cn: 为了减轻痛苦,我闭上双眼, 故意幻想这是幻象.

sentences.en: I think you need a shoot to deaden the pain first.
sentences.cn: 我看你需要先打一针止痛.

sentences.en: I think you need a shot to deaden the pain first.
sentences.cn: 我看你需要先打一针止痛针.

sentences.en: I'll give you a shot to deaden the pain first.
So little was needed to deaden her.
sentences.cn: 仅仅这么一点点打击就足以使她消沉.

sentences.en: Terror blunted her feelings; deaden a sound.
sentences.cn: 恐怖使她的知觉变得特别生硬; 使声音变弱.

sentences.en: They managed to deaden the sound on TV every time the alleged victim's name was spoken.
sentences.cn: 每当提到据称是受害者的人的姓名时，他们都设法调低电视机的声音。
这种药可消除痛苦[可止痛].

sentences.en: This drug will deaden the pain.
To deaden, as to feelings or moral scruples; callous.
sentences.cn: 使麻木不仁如使感情或道德良知麻木; 无情.

sentences.en: Two of these pills will deaden the ache.
sentences.cn: 服两粒丸药就会缓解疼痛.

sentences.en: We can deaden the noise of the room with thick walls.
sentences.cn: 我们可以用厚墙使房间隔音.

sentences.en: Wood is used to deaden the noise.

words.tran_cn: 无生命的；呆板的；废弃了的
致命的；非常的；死一般的
死；死一样的状态；无精打采
死，死亡；枯萎；失去活力（die的ing形式）
变得如死一般；失去活力

trans.tran_en: If something deadens a feeling or a sound, it makes it less strong or loud

trans.tran_cn: 抑制 （感情），缓和 （疼痛），减弱 （声音）
